reviewText: I almost had this entire film memorized have been in a frat in the early 80's I have watched it more then a few times. "Pledge him we need the dudes!" That was said so many times at the frat it was very welcome. There are many extras worth anything you need o topaz for it It is presented in full 16x9 screen viewing so it is very well presented.
Animal House is one of the best comedic movies.  I wish movies like this could be made today.  I love this movie.
Bought as a gift for my dad who loves this movie. Haven't given it to him yet, but I know he is going to love that he can watch it on Blu-Ray
What can you say about this movie that already has not been said.  One of the great classics of all time

This has always been one of my all-time favorite movies...classically funny (and on-point! lol!)  But this DVD exceeded my expectations with the extra "BONUS" tracks that were included!  I would highly recommend this to any fellow "Animal House" fans out there!!!

This is a great movie with some classic humor and great fun. And of course John Belushi if you under 30 ask your parents or google his name. He much like Chris Farley passed before his time due to tragic circumstances and this movie is one of his best. He starts the classic food fight scene and the scene where he destroys the guitar at the toga party. You should buy this just because Belushi is in it.

I can confirm as of Feb. 2014 the digital copy code works on iTunes unlike some other blu ray digital offerings
Bought as a present for some one
Hilarious. Timeless. Great transfer. Do the Blu-to to Blu-ray.

OK, I'm from this era.  I love this movie and watch it at least twice a year.  Who hasn't known a Flounder?

The video and audio quality are excellent.
Great film. Best frat movie ever. Stellar cast. All your favorites are here.
very funny movie and a classic great on blueray
Still makes me laugh decades after it came out.
Showed up earlier than expected. Great movie, everyone should own it! :)

What's not to like about this film?  It's like Blazing Saddles in breaking all the molds and traditions of film making.  WAY ahead of its time in the comedy world and one of the funniest flicks ever.  Belushi has never been better in any role, TV or movie....Jake Elwood a very close second.
